--- title: "flextable" description: "This is a subtitle" date: "2024-07-04" --- ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} library(flextable) library(tibble) library(stringr) library(dplyr) library(tidyr) ``` ::: Data for the table: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} sw <- starwars %>% select(name, height, mass, hair_color, eye_color, gender) %>% slice_head(n = 10) sw ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 10 Ã— 6 name height mass hair_color eye_color gender 1 Luke Skywalker 172 77 blond blue masculine 2 C-3PO 167 75 yellow masculine 3 R2-D2 96 32 red masculine 4 Darth Vader 202 136 none yellow masculine 5 Leia Organa 150 49 brown brown feminine 6 Owen Lars 178 120 brown, grey blue masculine 7 Beru Whitesun Lars 165 75 brown blue feminine 8 R5-D4 97 32 red masculine 9 Biggs Darklighter 183 84 black brown masculine 10 Obi-Wan Kenobi 182 77 auburn, white blue-gray masculine ``` ::: ::: ## Basic use Passing to `flextable()` ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} sw %>% flextable() ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ```{=html}

name

height

``` ::: ::: Using `autofit()` to produce nice column spacing: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} sw %>% flextable() %>% autofit() ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ```{=html}

name

height

mass

hair_color

``` ::: ::: Combine with dplyr to tidy up printed values: ::: {.cell} ```{.e .cell-code} sw %>% mutate(across(hair_color:gender, str_to_title)) %>% flextable() %>% autofit() ``` ::: Use `set_header_labels()` to format the column labels: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} sw %>% mutate(across(hair_color:gender, str_to_title)) %>% flextable() %>% autofit() %>% set_header_labels( name = "Character Name", height = "Height (cm)", mass = "Mass (kg)", hair_color = "Hair Color", eye_color = "Eye Color", sex = "Sex", gender = "Gender", starships = "Starships" ) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ```{=html}

Character Name

Height (cm)

``` ::: ::: ## Cell contents Use `compose()` or `mk_par()` (the latter is an alias to make life easier in case of conficts between `purrr::compose()` and `flextable::compose()` to build cell contents from constituent parts: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} sw %>% mutate(across(hair_color:gender, str_to_title)) %>% flextable() %>% autofit() %>% set_header_labels( name = "Character Name", height = "Height", mass = "Mass", hair_color = "Hair Color", eye_color = "Eye Color", sex = "Sex", gender = "Gender", starships = "Starships" ) %>% compose( j = "height", value = as_paragraph(height, "cm") ) %>% compose( j = "mass", value = as_paragraph(mass, "kg") ) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ```{=html}

Character Name

Height

Mass

Hair Color

Eye Color

Gender

Luke Skywalker

``` ::: ::: Fancier formatting to a specific chunk using `as_chunk()` and `fp_text_default()`: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} sw %>% mutate(across(hair_color:gender, str_to_title)) %>% flextable() %>% autofit() %>% set_header_labels( name = "Character Name", height = "Height", mass = "Mass", hair_color = "Hair Color", eye_color = "Eye Color", sex = "Sex", gender = "Gender", starships = "Starships" ) %>% compose( j = "height", value = as_paragraph( height, as_chunk("cm", props = fp_text_default(color = "grey50")) ) ) %>% compose( j = "mass", value = as_paragraph( mass, as_chunk("kg", props = fp_text_default(color = "grey50")) ) ) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ```{=html}

Character Name

Height

Mass

Eye Color

``` ::: ::: Using fancier row selectors to get contextual formatting: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} sw %>% mutate(across(hair_color:gender, str_to_title)) %>% flextable() %>% autofit() %>% set_header_labels( name = "Character Name", height = "Height", mass = "Mass", hair_color = "Hair Color", eye_color = "Eye Color", sex = "Sex", gender = "Gender", starships = "Starships" ) %>% compose( j = "height", value = as_paragraph( height, as_chunk("cm", props = fp_text_default(color = "grey50")) ) ) %>% compose( j = "mass", value = as_paragraph( mass, as_chunk("kg", props = fp_text_default(color = "grey50")) ) ) %>% color( i = ~ eye_color == "Red", j = "eye_color", color = "red" ) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ```{=html}

Character Name

Height

Mass

Hair Color

Eye Color

Gender

``` ::: ::: Notice that `color()` here is just a convenience function. I could do the same thing using `compose()`, `as_paragraph()`, `as_chunk()`, and `fp_text_default()`: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} sw %>% mutate(across(hair_color:gender, str_to_title)) %>% flextable() %>% autofit() %>% set_header_labels( name = "Character Name", height = "Height", mass = "Mass", hair_color = "Hair Color", eye_color = "Eye Color", sex = "Sex", gender = "Gender", starships = "Starships" ) %>% compose( j = "height", value = as_paragraph( height, as_chunk("cm", props = fp_text_default(color = "grey50")) ) ) %>% compose( j = "mass", value = as_paragraph( mass, as_chunk("kg", props = fp_text_default(color = "grey50")) ) ) %>% compose( i = ~ eye_color == "Blue", j = "eye_color", value = as_paragraph(as_chunk( eye_color, props = fp_text_default(color = "blue") ) )) %>% color( i = ~ eye_color == "Red", j = "eye_color", color = "red" ) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ```{=html}

Character Name

``` ::: ::: ## Grouped tables Data for the table: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} sw <- starwars %>% select(name, starships) %>% slice_head(n = 10) %>% unnest(cols = c(starships)) sw ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 9 Ã— 2 name starships 1 Luke Skywalker X-wing 2 Luke Skywalker Imperial shuttle 3 Darth Vader TIE Advanced x1 4 Biggs Darklighter X-wing 5 Obi-Wan Kenobi Jedi starfighter 6 Obi-Wan Kenobi Trade Federation cruiser 7 Obi-Wan Kenobi Naboo star skiff 8 Obi-Wan Kenobi Jedi Interceptor 9 Obi-Wan Kenobi Belbullab-22 starfighter ``` ::: ::: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} sw %>% flextable() %>% set_header_labels(name = "Name", starships = "Starships") %>% autofit() %>% theme_box() ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ```{=html}

Name

Starships

Luke Skywalker

X-wing

Luke Skywalker

Imperial shuttle

Darth Vader

TIE Advanced x1

Biggs Darklighter

X-wing

Obi-Wan Kenobi

Jedi starfighter

Obi-Wan Kenobi

Trade Federation cruiser

Obi-Wan Kenobi

Naboo star skiff

Obi-Wan Kenobi

Jedi Interceptor

Obi-Wan Kenobi

Belbullab-22 starfighter

``` ::: ::: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} sw %>% flextable() %>% set_header_labels(name = "Name", starships = "Starships") %>% autofit() %>% merge_v(j = "name") %>% theme_box() ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ```{=html}

Name

Starships

Luke Skywalker

X-wing

Imperial shuttle

Darth Vader

TIE Advanced x1

Biggs Darklighter

X-wing

Obi-Wan Kenobi

Jedi starfighter

Trade Federation cruiser

Naboo star skiff

Jedi Interceptor

Belbullab-22 starfighter

``` ::: ::: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} sw %>% as_grouped_data(groups = "name") %>% flextable() %>% set_header_labels(name = "Name", starships = "Starships") %>% autofit() %>% theme_box() ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ```{=html}

Name

Starships

``` ::: :::
